wavelength of light using plane transmission grating

Hour 1: (Prerequisites : Electric Charges, Coulomb's law-force between two point
charges, Electric field, electric field due to a point charge, electric field lines,
electric dipole, electric field due to a dipole, Gauss's law, Faraday‘s law)
Scalar and Vector field, Physical significance of gradient, curl and divergence in
Cartesian co-ordinate system, Gauss‘s law for electrostatics, Gauss‘s law for
magnetostatics, Faraday‘s Law and Ampere‘s circuital law

Hour 1: (Prerequisites: Cartesian co-ordinate system)
Special theory of Relativity: Inertial and Non-inertial Frames of reference,
Galilean transformations, Lorentz transformations (space – time coordinates),
Time Dilation, Length Contraction and Mass-Energy relation

Hour 1: (Prerequisites : Scattering of electrons, Tunneling effect, Electrostatic focusing,
magneto static focusing)
Nanomaterials : Properties (Optical, electrical, magnetic, structural, mechanical)
and applications, Surface to volume ratio

Hour 2: Two main approaches in
nanotechnology -Bottom up technique and Top down technique

Hour 3: Tools for characterization of Nanoparticles: Scanning Electron Microscope
(SEM), Transmission Electron Microscope (TEM), Atomic Force Microscope
(AFM)

Hour 4: Methods to synthesize Nanomaterials: Ball milling, Sputtering, Vapour
deposition, Solgel

Hour 1: (Prerequisites : Transducer concept, meaning of calibration, piezoelectric
effect)
Resistive sensors:
a) Temperature measurement: PT100 construction, calibration,
b) Humidity measurement using resistive sensors,
Pressure sensor: Concept of pressure sensing by capacitive, flex and inductive
method, Analog pressure sensor: construction working and calibration and
applications

Hour 2: Piezoelectric transducers: Concept of piezoelectricity, use of piezoelectric
transducer as ultrasonic generator and application of ultrasonic transducer for
distance measurement, liquid and air velocity measurement

Hour 3: Optical sensor: Photodiode, construction and use of photodiode as ambient light
measurement and flux measurement

Hour 4: Pyroelectric sensors: Construction and working principle, application of
pyroelectric sensor as bolometer
Hour 5: Review and practice

Classification of spectroscopy – atomic and molecular, selection rules

Hour 2: Table of relation between electromagnetic spectrum, types of spectroscopy and
energy changes

Hour 1: Emission spectroscopy- Principle, Instrumentation and applications ( Flame
Photometry)
Introduction to florescence and phosphorescence, Jablonski diagram, application
of fluorescence in medicine only

Hour 4: Review and practice
Hour 1: Introduction, concept of electrode potential, Nernst equation, types of electrochemical cells, concept of standard electrode with examples, electrochemical series, simplenumericals
Hour 2: Review and practice

Hour 1: Definition, Mechanism of Corrosion- (I) Dry or Chemical Corrosion-i) Due to
oxygen ii)Due to other gases

Hour 2: (II)Wet or Electrochemical corrosion- Mechanism
 i) Evolution of hydrogen type ii) Absorption of oxygen

Hour 3: Types of Corrosion- Galvanic cell corrosion, Concentration cell corrosion
(differential aeration principle), Pitting corrosion, Intergranular corrosion, Stress
corrosion

Hour 4: Factors affecting the rate of corrosion- (i)Nature of metal, (ii)Nature of corroding
environment

Hour 5: Methods of corrosion control- (I)Material selection and proper designing,(II)
Cathodic protection- i) Sacrificial anodic protection ii) Impressed current
method,(III) Metallic coatings- only Cathodic coating (tinning) and anodic
coatings (Galvanising)
Hour 6: Review and practice

Hour 1: Definition, classification, characteristics of a good fuel, units of heat (no
conversions)

Hour 2: Calorific value- Definition, Gross or Higher calorific value & Net or lower
calorific value, Dulong‘s formula & numerical for calculations of Gross and Net
calorific values

Hour 3: Solid fuels- Analysis of coal- Proximate and Ultimate Analysis- numerical
problems and significance

Hour 4: Liquid fuels- Petrol- Knocking, Octane number, Cetane number, Antiknocking
agents, unleaded petrol, oxygenates (MTBE), catalytic converter

Hour 5: Combustion- Calculations for requirement of only oxygen and air (by weight and
by volume only) for given solid & gaseous fuels
Hour 6: Review and practice
